CTRexPktBuilder class¶

class packet_builder.CTRexPktBuilder(max_pkt_size=1518)[source]¶

This class defines the TRex API of building a packet using dpkt package. Using this class the user can also define how TRex will handle the packet by specifying the VM setting.

Instantiate a CTRexPktBuilder object

Parameters:None
add_pkt_layer(layer_name, pkt_layer)[source]¶

This method adds additional header to the already existing packet

Parameters:
layer_name: str

a string representing the name of the layer. Example: “l2”, “l4_tcp”, etc.

pkt_layer : dpkt.Packet obj

a dpkt object, generally from higher layer, that will be added on top of existing layer.
Raises:
  • ValueError, in case the desired layer_name already exists.
set_ip_layer_addr(layer_name, attr, ip_addr, ip_type='ipv4')[source]¶

This method sets the IP address fields of an IP header (source or destination, for both IPv4 and IPv6) using a human readable addressing representation.

Parameters:
layer_name: str

a string representing the name of the layer. Example: “l3_ip”, etc.

attr: str

a string representation of the sub-field to be set:

  • “src” for source
  • “dst” for destination
ip_addr: str

a string representation of the IP address to be set. Example: “10.0.0.1” for IPv4, or “5001::DB8:1:3333:1:1” for IPv6

ip_type : str

a string representation of the IP version to be set:

  • “ipv4” for IPv4
  • “ipv6” for IPv6

Default: ipv4
Raises:
  • ValueError, in case the desired layer_name is not an IP layer
  • KeyError, in case the desired layer_name does not exists.
set_ipv6_layer_addr(layer_name, attr, ip_addr)[source]¶

This method sets the IPv6 address fields of an IP header (source or destination)

Parameters:
layer_name: str

a string representing the name of the layer. Example: “l3_ip”, etc.

attr: str

a string representation of the sub-field to be set:

  • “src” for source
  • “dst” for destination
ip_addr: str

a string representation of the IP address to be set. Example: “5001::DB8:1:3333:1:1”
Raises:
  • ValueError, in case the desired layer_name is not an IPv6 layer
  • KeyError, in case the desired layer_name does not exists.
set_eth_layer_addr(layer_name, attr, mac_addr)[source]¶

This method sets the ethernet address fields of an Ethernet header (source or destination) using a human readable addressing representation.

Parameters:
layer_name: str

a string representing the name of the layer. Example: “l2”, etc.

attr: str

a string representation of the sub-field to be set: + “src” for source + “dst” for destination

mac_addr: str

a string representation of the MAC address to be set. Example: “00:de:34:ef:2e:f4”.
Raises:
  • ValueError, in case the desired layer_name is not an Ethernet layer
  • KeyError, in case the desired layer_name does not exists.
set_layer_attr(layer_name, attr, val, toggle_bit=False)[source]¶

This method enables the user to change a value of a previously defined packet layer. This method isn’t to be used to set the data attribute of a packet with payload. Use packet_builder.CTRexPktBuilder.set_payload() instead.

Parameters:
layer_name: str

a string representing the name of the layer. Example: “l2”, “l4_tcp”, etc.

attr : str

a string representing the attribute to be changed on desired layer

val :

value of attribute.

toggle_bit : bool

Indicating if trying to set a specific bit of a field, such as “do not fragment” bit of IP layer.

Default: False
Raises:
  • KeyError, in case of missing layer (the desired layer isn’t part of packet)
  • ValueError, in case invalid attribute to the specified layer.
set_layer_bit_attr(layer_name, attr, val)[source]¶

This method enables the user to set the value of a field smaller that 1 Byte in size. This method isn’t used to set full-sized fields value (>= 1 byte). Use packet_builder.CTRexPktBuilder.set_layer_attr() instead.

Parameters:
layer_name: str

a string representing the name of the layer. Example: “l2”, “l4_tcp”, etc.

attr : str

a string representing the attribute to be set on desired layer

val : int

value of attribute. This value will be set “ontop” of the existing value using bitwise “OR” operation.

Tip

It is very useful to use dpkt constants to define the values of these fields.
Raises:
  • KeyError, in case of missing layer (the desired layer isn’t part of packet)
  • ValueError, in case invalid attribute to the specified layer.
set_pkt_payload(payload)[source]¶

This method sets a payload to the topmost layer of the generated packet. This method isn’t to be used to set another networking layer to the packet. Use packet_builder.CTRexPktBuilder.set_layer_attr() instead.

Parameters:
payload:

a payload to be added to the packet at the topmost layer. this object cannot be of type dpkt.Packet.
Raises:
  • AttributeError, in case no underlying header to host the payload.
load_packet(packet)[source]¶

This method enables the user to change a value of a previously defined packet layer.

Parameters:
packet: dpkt.Packet obj

a dpkt object that represents a packet.
Raises:
  • CTRexPktBuilder.IPAddressError, in case invalid ip type option specified.
get_packet(get_ptr=False)[source]¶

This method provides access to the built packet, as an instance or as a pointer to packet itself.

Parameters:
get_ptr : bool

indicate whether to get a reference to packet or a copy. Use only in advanced modes if set to true, metadata for packet is cleared, and any further modification is not guaranteed.

default value : False
Returns:

  • the current packet built by CTRexPktBuilder object.
  • None if packet is empty
get_layer(layer_name)[source]¶

This method provides access to a specific layer of the packet, as a copy of the layer instance.

Parameters:
layer_name : str

the name given to desired layer
Returns:

  • a copy of the desired layer of the current packet if exists.
  • None if no such layer
dump_pkt()[source]¶

Dumps the packet as a decimal array of bytes (each item x gets value between 0-255)

Parameters:

None
Returns:

  • packet representation as array of bytes
Raises:
  • CTRexPktBuilder.EmptyPacketError, in case packet is empty.
dump_pkt_to_pcap(file_path, ts=None)[source]¶

Dumps the packet as a decimal array of bytes (each item x gets value between 0-255)

Parameters:
file_path : str

a path (including filename) to which to write to pcap file to.

ts : int

a timestamp to attach to the packet when dumped to pcap file. if ts in None, then time.time() is used to set the timestamp.

Default: None
Returns:

None
Raises:
  • CTRexPktBuilder.EmptyPacketError, in case packet is empty.
class CTRexVM[source]¶

This class defines the TRex VM which represents how TRex will regenerate packets. The packets will be regenerated based on the built packet containing this class.

Instantiate a CTRexVM object

Parameters:None
class InstStore(type, inst)¶
inst¶

Alias for field number 1

type¶

Alias for field number 0

CTRexPktBuilder.CTRexVM.set_vm_var_field(var_name, field_name, val, offset_inst=False)[source]¶

Set VM variable field. Only existing variables are allowed to be changed.

Parameters:
var_name : str

a string representing the name of the VM variable to be changed.

field_name : str

a string representing the field name of the VM variable to be changed.

val :

a value to be applied to field_name field of the var_name VM variable.
Raises:
  • KeyError, in case invalid var_name has been specified.
  • CTRexPktBuilder.VMVarFieldTypeError, in case mismatch between val and allowed type.
  • CTRexPktBuilder.VMVarValueError, in case val isn’t one of allowed options of field_name.
CTRexPktBuilder.CTRexVM.add_flow_man_inst(name, **kwargs)[source]¶

Adds a new flow manipulation object to the VM instance.

Parameters:
name : str

name of the manipulation, must be distinct. Example: ‘source_ip_change’

kwargs : dict

optional, set flow_man fields on initialization (key = field_name, val = field_val). Must be used with legit fields, see CTRexPktBuilder.CTRexVM.CTRexVMVariable.set_field().
Returns:

None
Raises:
  • CTRexPktBuilder.VMVarNameExistsError, in case of desired flow_man name already taken.
  • Exceptions from CTRexPktBuilder.CTRexVM.CTRexVMVariable.set_field() method. Will rise when VM variables were misconfiguration.
CTRexPktBuilder.CTRexVM.load_flow_man(flow_obj)[source]¶

Loads an outer VM variable (instruction) into current VM. The outer VM variable must contain different name than existing VM variables currently registered on VM.

Parameters:
flow_obj : CTRexVMVariable

a CTRexVMVariable to be loaded into VM variable sets.
Returns:

list holds variables data of VM
CTRexPktBuilder.CTRexVM.dump()[source]¶

dumps a VM variables (instructions) into a list data structure.

Parameters:None
Returns:list holds variables data of VM
class CTRexPktBuilder.CTRexVM.CTRexVMFlowVariable(name)[source]¶

This class defines a single VM variable to be used as part of CTRexVar object.

Instantiate a CTRexVMVariable object

Parameters:
name : str

a string representing the name of the VM variable.
set_field(field_name, val)[source]¶

Set VM variable field. Only existing variables are allowed to be changed.

Parameters:
field_name : str

a string representing the field name of the VM variable to be changed.

val :

a value to be applied to field_name field of the var_name VM variable.
Returns:

None
Raises:
  • CTRexPktBuilder.VMVarNameError, in case of illegal field name.
  • CTRexPktBuilder.VMVarFieldTypeError, in case mismatch between val and allowed type.
  • CTRexPktBuilder.VMVarValueError, in case val isn’t one of allowed options of field_name.
dump()[source]¶

dumps a variable fields in a dictionary data structure.

Parameters:None
Returns:dictionary holds variable data of VM variable
exception CTRexPktBuilder.CPacketBuildException(code, message)[source]¶

This is the general Packet Building error exception class.

exception CTRexPktBuilder.EmptyPacketError(message='')[source]¶

This exception is used to indicate an error caused by operation performed on an empty packet.

exception CTRexPktBuilder.IPAddressError(message='')[source]¶

This exception is used to indicate an error on the IP addressing part of the packet.

exception CTRexPktBuilder.MACAddressError(message='')[source]¶

This exception is used to indicate an error on the MAC addressing part of the packet.

exception CTRexPktBuilder.PacketLayerError(name, message='')[source]¶

This exception is used to indicate an error caused by operation performed on an non-exists layer of the packet.

exception CTRexPktBuilder.PacketLayerTypeError(name, layer_type, ok_type, message='')[source]¶

This exception is used to indicate an error caused by operation performed on an non-exists layer of the packet.

exception CTRexPktBuilder.VMVarNameExistsError(name, message='')[source]¶

This exception is used to indicate a duplicate usage of VM variable.

exception CTRexPktBuilder.VMFieldNameError(name, message='')[source]¶

This exception is used to indicate that an undefined VM var field name has been accessed.

exception CTRexPktBuilder.VMFieldTypeError(name, ok_type, message='')[source]¶

This exception is used to indicate an illegal value has type has been given to VM variable field.

exception CTRexPktBuilder.VMFieldValueError(name, ok_opts, message='')[source]¶

This exception is used to indicate an error an illegal value has been assigned to VM variable field.

Packet Builder Exceptions¶

For exceptions documentation see here: Packet Builder Exceptions
